poem:
Title: "Sketches from a Tattered Headline"

Ink seeps, a systems blare, drone shadow in eastern light,
Aden wakes to steel wings, echoes of distant nights.
Land of Lebanon waits, knotted in fear-tight,
As rebels bask in the crimsoned Red Sea sight.
Western warning winds whisper muted spite,
In the terse telegram of a terror night.
